Start by researching the types of plants that are best suited to your climate and soil type. This will help you create a garden that thrives and produces bountiful harvests.
Consider the layout of your garden. Think about how you want to use the space and what types of plants will work well together.
Make sure to plan for proper irrigation and drainage. This will help keep your plants healthy and prevent water damage.
Consider using raised garden beds or containers to improve soil quality and drainage.
Don't forget to factor in the amount of time and effort you're willing to put into maintaining your garden. This will help you choose plants that are suitable for your lifestyle and skill level.
